text: Always look at the whole board before you move. Even the smallest pawn can have a big dream.
author: ChessPaa

text: Before you attack, ask yourself: what is my king doing?
author: ChessPaa

text: In chess, every move is a message. Make sure yours says something smart.
author: ChessPaa

text: Don’t rush your queen out early—let the little pieces warm up first.
author: ChessPaa

text: If you see a good move, stop and look for a better one.
author: Classic wisdom

text: A safe king is a happy king. Castle early when you can.
author: ChessPaa

text: Every blunder is a teacher wearing a silly hat.
author: ChessPaa

text: Control the center and the board will start listening to you.
author: ChessPaa

text: Pieces work best when they help each other. Don’t let them feel lonely.
author: ChessPaa

text: Sometimes the bravest move is to quietly improve your position.
author: ChessPaa

text: A pawn that reaches the end of the board remembers every step it took.
author: ChessPaa

text: Think checks, captures, and threats—but never forget your own safety.
author: ChessPaa

text: Good players see tactics. Great players see plans.
author: ChessPaa

text: When you’re winning, don’t rush. When you’re losing, don’t panic.
author: ChessPaa

text: Endgames are the bedtime stories of chess. Quiet, deep, and full of magic.
author: ChessPaa
